messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Update on Ren?
messages.msgSnippet: I don t know how much info Ren would like spread, so I ll let her write when she has time. But... She and her kids are back from Alaska. I talked with her
messages.messageBody:
I don't know how much info Ren would like spread, so I'll let her write
when she has time. But...

She and her kids are back from Alaska. I talked with her Thursday. Her
computer's dead, so she goes to the library. They left Friday for upper
Alabama to stay with friends until the storm blows over.They may be
travelling further up to TN for a night or two. I invited them here if
they need to.

She has little hope for the Pensacola area. I hope she'll be pleasantly
surprised.

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
October 6-9, 2005
http://liveandlearnconference.org

-----Original Message-----
From: Danielle Conger <danielle.conger@...>


How's Ren doing--has anyone heard? Is she back from Alaska yet even?

My mom (who lives in Gulf Shores, AL) is up visiting, but it seems they
were spared this time around. All the folks in Pensacola are in my
thoughts. I'm hoping they got spared being on the west of the hurricane
this time around.

messages.subject: conference stuff
messages.msgSnippet: There are a few new things up on the site: http://liveandlearnconference.org ----and more coming in every few days. Also a few changes and corrections. (If
messages.messageBody:
There are a few new things up on the site:
http://liveandlearnconference.org ----and more coming in every few days.

Also a few changes and corrections. (If y'all see any mistakes, please
let me know!)

The overflow hotel is the Drury Inn. We have 60 rooms blocked right
now, and they will add more as we need them. (There are a few
suites!---but HURRY!) Rooms must be booked by September 17 to get the
special rate of $89!

I want to remind folks about the raffle and the new "Hometown Baskets"
silent auction.

We have a special guest: Share Faeber is a caricaturist---take home a
little momento of the conference! Only $7 per!

Be sure to take a peek at the City Museum (www.citymuseum.org)---it's
our Saturday night excursion! An organic museum that changes
daily----truly amazing! I was there last week and was BLOWN AWAY!!!

If you've been considering offering a funshop---now's the time to step
up. I have a very few slots left, but I need to fill them. Let me know
asap!

I'm sending confirmations out as they come in now, so if you have sent
me your registration and haven't received a confirmation, holler at
me!!! I've found two in my spam folder! (I check there every day now!)

*****Most importantly: the Early Bird Deadline is July 31!!! PLEASE be
sure to send your registrations in before the 31!!! That's the end of
THIS month!!!*******

Please feel free to forward this one to other groups.

Thanks so much!

Now, back to your regularly scheduled unschooling discussion....

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
October 6-9, 2005
http://liveandlearnconference.org
liveandlearnconference@yahoogroups.com
